bug.author: ricgu8086
bug.description: Hi, I've just installed streamlit in python 3.5.2 with pip (streamlit==0.56.0), and when I executed streamlit hello and click the link, a webpage was openned. I choose "Plotting Demo" from the dropdown menu and I got this bug "TypeError: 'ellipsis' object is not iterable" I include the full traceback <denchmark-code>TypeError: 'ellipsis' object is not iterable Traceback: File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/streamlit/ScriptRunner.py", line 314, in _run_script exec(code, module.__dict__) File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/streamlit/hello/hello.py", line 364, in <module> File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/streamlit/hello/hello.py", line 99, in run demo() File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/streamlit/hello/demos.py", line 195, in plotting_demo chart = st.line_chart(last_rows) File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/streamlit/DeltaGenerator.py", line 131, in wrapped_method return dg._enqueue_new_element_delta(marshall_element, delta_type, last_index) File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/streamlit/DeltaGenerator.py", line 360, in _enqueue_new_element_delta rv = marshall_element(msg.delta.new_element) File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/streamlit/DeltaGenerator.py", line 129, in marshall_element return method(dg, element, *args, **kwargs) File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/streamlit/DeltaGenerator.py", line 895, in line_chart import streamlit.elements.altair as altair File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/streamlit/elements/altair.py", line 25, in <module> import altair as alt File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/altair/__init__.py", line 4, in <module> from .vegalite import * File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/altair/vegalite/__init__.py", line 2, in <module> from .v4 import * File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/altair/vegalite/v4/__init__.py", line 3, in <module> from .api import * File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/altair/vegalite/v4/api.py", line 15, in <module> from .display import renderers, VEGALITE_VERSION, VEGAEMBED_VERSION, VEGA_VERSION File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/altair/vegalite/v4/display.py", line 4, in <module> from ..display import Displayable File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/altair/vegalite/display.py", line 1, in <module> from ..utils.display import Displayable, default_renderer_base, json_renderer_base File "/home/ricardo/Documentos/Repos_varios/avocado-prediction/heroku_local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/altair/utils/display.py", line 20, in <module> class RendererRegistry(PluginRegistry[RendererType]): File "/usr/lib/python3.5/typing.py", line 1025, in __getitem__ tvars = _type_vars(params) File "/usr/lib/python3.5/typing.py", line 284, in _type_vars _get_type_vars(types, tvars) File "/usr/lib/python3.5/typing.py", line 279, in _get_type_vars t._get_type_vars(tvars) File "/usr/lib/python3.5/typing.py", line 786, in _get_type_vars _get_type_vars(self.__args__, tvars) File comments.comment: Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ricgu8086>@ricgu8086</denchmark-link> , Would you be able to upgrade your Python version ? I don't get the error on Python 3.6.x, nor on Python 3.5.6. It is recommended to run Streamlit with <denchmark-link:https://docs.streamlit.io/getting_started.html#prerequisites>at least Python 3.6</denchmark-link> . Hopefully you can upgrade without too much a problem.

Seems to be a <denchmark-link:https://github.com/altair-viz/altair/issues/972#issuecomment-400311001>bug</denchmark-link> with python 3.5.2 Our docs recommend to use Streamlit with at least 3.6 but we currently test against 3.5.9 and 3.8.1 Looking into whether to update the docs or to drop support for 3.5
